info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 5:36PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Daniels, north central Roosevelt and southwestern Sheridan Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 536 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Bredette, or 17 miles southeast of Scobey, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and small hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Daniels, north central Roosevelt and southwestern Sheridan Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
